alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 2:46PM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW EXPECTED DURING THE CHRISTMAS HOLIDAY... .A series of cold upper level storm systems has lowered snow levels to around 1500 feet today, and may occasionally drop snow levels to sea level tonight through Monday morning. Periods of heavy showers spreading across the cold airmass will favor significant mountain snowfall lasting through Monday morning. Travel across mountain roadways and highway passes will subsequently be difficult if not impossible. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches possible. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte and Northern Humboldt Coast Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 10 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute including highway 101. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall will likely be wet and mixed with rain. Snowfall will be sporadic with accumulation most likely a couple hundred feet above sea level.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Northern Humboldt Coast
